title: Understanding Ideas of Reference
text: Ideas of reference involve a belief that random events or coincidences are directly related to oneself. This is a common symptom in certain mental health conditions.

hintAnswer: false belief that coincidental events relate to oneself
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes ideas of reference?
choices: pervasive pattern of distrust and suspicion of others
pattern of detachment from social relationships and a limited range of emotional expression
odd or eccentric behavior, unusual beliefs or magical thinking, social and interpersonal difficulties, and a tendency toward perceptual and cognitive distortions
false belief that coincidental events relate to oneself
